title: How to Look Good in the Morning

steps.title: Pick out your outfit.
steps.content: Pick out your outfit. Before you go to bed, decide what you will wear tomorrow. This will keep you from digging through your closet, trying on a bunch of clothes, and making a mess. Once you make a choice, lay out the shoes, accessories, and anything else you plan to wear. Keep your closet organized so it's easy to see what you have. Also, get rid of anything that doesn't make you feel amazing, so that way you don't have to spend time sifting through things you don't really like when you're getting ready each day. [1] X Expert Source Ashley Kahn Wardrobe Stylist Expert Interview. 30 September 2020. Check the weather and your schedule to make sure your outfit is appropriate. Do you have an important meeting the next day? Is it going to be hot and humid or rainy?

steps.title: Get enough sleep.
steps.content: Get enough sleep. Sleep is important for your mental and physical health. Try to get between 7 and 9 hours of sleep each night. While you are sleeping, blood flow to your skin increases. Adequate sleep will keep your eyes from being puffy and keep you from waking up with dull skin. [2] X Research source It's important for you to develop a regular sleeping schedule. Over time, not getting enough sleep causes your skin to age and makes you more prone to wrinkles. [3] X Research source Sleep on a silk or satin pillowcase. These materials are less drying for your skin and will keep you from waking up with creases on your face. [4] X Research source Some people may need more than 9 hours of sleep of night or less than 7 hours of sleep a night. Adjust the time based on your needs and how you feel when you wake up in the morning. Avoid alcohol, caffeine, and nicotine because they can keep you awake or disrupt your natural sleep cycle. Try not to nap too close to your bedtime or you will have difficulty falling and staying asleep.

steps.title: Stay hydrated.
steps.content: Stay hydrated. Your skin is comprised primarily of water and needs to be hydrated from both the inside and outside. If you do not drink enough water, your skin can become dry and flaky. Aim for 8 glasses of water a day to keep your skin hydrated and looking healthy. [5] X Trustworthy Source University of Wisconsin Health Integrated healthcare system of the University of Wisconsin focused on treating and providing support to patients and public health initiatives Go to source Moisturize your skin after a bath, shower, and when you wash your hands. Your skin absorbs moisture best when it is damp.

steps.title: Wash your face.
steps.content: Wash your face. Always wash your face before you go to bed. [6] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source During the day, your skin is exposed to pollution, dirt, sweat, and bacteria. [7] X Research source Washing your face at night will remove all of the day's gunk from your face. Going to bed with a dirty face can cause an acne breakout [8] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source and leave you with dull-looking skin in the morning. Everyone should wash their face at night, but this is particularly important if you wear makeup. Sleeping in makeup can clog your pores and lead to breakouts.

steps.title: Moisturize your skin.
steps.content: Moisturize your skin. Nighttime is a great time to moisturize your skin. Although you are sleeping, your body is still working to repair your tissues. The increased blood flow you experience when you sleep helps your skin better absorb the moisture that you apply to your skin. [9] X Research source This is the time to use heavier, thicker moisturizers. Moisturizers are best when applied to clean, slightly damp skin. Try to do this after you bathe and wash your face for the night. Reader Poll: We asked 1212 wikiHow readers if they believe that makeup is required to look great, and 66% of them said no . [Take Poll] You heard it here firstâ€”even though makeup can make you feel and look awesome, you can also be a stunner with just your natural beauty.

steps.title: Prep your hair.
steps.content: Prep your hair. Sleeping with your hair prepped can help you wake up to a good hair day the next morning. If you have longer hair, put your hair in a ponytail and wrap it into a twist. When you wake up in the morning, you will have soft waves in your hair. If your hair is not long enough for one ponytail, try doing little mini-buns all over your head for the same effect. Tie the ponytails loosely to prevent creases in your hair. [10] X Research source If you shower at night, you can braid your wet hair to add some texture. You can also wash your hair at night and apply dry shampoo in the morning if you have oily hair. If you are prone to frizzy hair, wrap your hair with a silk scarf or sleep on a silk pillowcase.

steps.title: Wake up early enough.
steps.content: Wake up early enough. Set your alarm and give yourself enough time to go through your morning routine. [11] X Expert Source Sandra Possing Life Coach Expert Interview. 15 July 2020. If you are not sure how long it will take you to get ready, time yourself one weekend morning. Once you know how long it will take you, you can set your alarm for a good time during the week. If you go to bed at a decent time, it will be easier for you to wake up at the time you need to.

steps.title: Eat breakfast.
steps.content: Eat breakfast. Eating a healthy breakfast can get your day off to a good start and fuel your body. Your breakfast should be a combination of whole grains, lean protein, low-fat dairy, and fruits and vegetables. [12] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Part of looking good is having plenty of energy and getting the necessary vitamins and minerals your body needs. Good breakfast options include: oatmeal with almonds or dried fruit, fruit and vegetable smoothie, multi-grain pancakes with fruit and yogurt, whole-grain waffle/bread with peanut butter, or an egg omelet with vegetables. [13] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Drink plenty of water as part of your breakfast. If you are rushed for time in the morning, prep your breakfast ingredients the night before.

steps.title: Take care of your skin.
steps.content: Take care of your skin. Healthy, clean skin will have a nice glow and help you look refreshed. Wash your face with a gentle cleanser and moisturize your face in the morning. [14] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source You should also apply sunscreen before you leave for the day. Use sunscreen that is at least SPF 30. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Use a lighter moisturizer than you used at night. You can also try a tinted moisturizer to give your skin a nice glow and a more even tone.

steps.title: Get rid of puffy eyes and dark circles.
steps.content: Get rid of puffy eyes and dark circles. Apply a cold compress to your eyes to get rid of dark circles and puffiness. A cold spoon or a bag of frozen peas can be used as a compress. To further reduce puffiness, sleep with your head elevated to prevent fluid from pooling under your eyes. [16] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Place the spoon in the refrigerator instead of the freezer so it will not be too cold. You can put the spoon in the fridge the night before. Wrap the frozen peas in a cloth before applying to your face. If the cold compress doesn't work, apply a concealer with yellow undertones to hide dark circles under your eyes. [17] X Research source Used tea bags can also be used to reduce puffiness. Steep your tea bags in hot water, allow them to cool a little, squeeze out excess liquid and then apply to your eye area. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Try to exercise.
steps.content: Try to exercise. It might be difficult, but try to exercise in the morning. Exercise increases blood flow, releases feel-good hormones, and gives you a nice glow. [19] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you can, get in 30 minutes of exercise [20] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source , but even a brisk 10 minute walk can get the blood flowing. Exercise will improve your mood and give you more energy for the day.
